page.title: 05Shopping, Bridgham
page.content:
Bridgham's last shop closed in l984; therefore, the people of Bridgham have to travel to the surrounding towns and villages for their provisions.
Our survey of shopping trends showed that Thetford (7 miles away and served by a Petch of Hopton coach on Tuesdays) is the most important centre, with East Harling (2 miles) a close second. Third in popularity is Bury St. Edmunds (21 miles and served by Petch's coaches on Wednesdays and Saturdays). Norwich, the county town, (25 miles) is fourth and Diss (14 miles) is fifth. Our survey revealed that people also visit places as far away as Yarmouth, Cambridge and King's Lynn. We are also served by mobile shops; there are regular visits from mobile baker, grocer, fishmongers and the County Library.
